p: Lastly, dual infection by CDV/CPV seems to be overall less frequent, at least in wild carnivores in European as we only detected in three canids in our study. The lack of case reports makes it hard to predict impacts and consequences of infections. However, research on other species highlighted a case of fatal canine distemper infection in African wild dogs with concurrent infection by CPV in 2/6 individuals, leading the authors to believe that co-infections may have contributed to the fatal outcome in some of the dogs [ 53].
